problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the area of the lime semi-circle is 39.25, the ABFG shape is a rectangle where a semi-circle has been removed from one side of it and the perimeter of the ABFG shape is 78, compute the area of the ABCD rectangle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (19753.26, 34.23)
C = (19753.26, 10031.69)
D = (34.23, 10031.69)
F = (19753.26, -14965.77)
G = (34.23, -14965.77)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 10))

# Adjust axis limits for better presentation
ax.set_xlim(-9965.77, 30034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-19965.77, 20034.23)

# Draw the green rectangle (A, B, C, D)
green_rectangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D], closed=True, color="green", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(green_rectangle)

# Draw the lime arc (D, A)
arc_center_DA = (D[0], D[1])
arc_radius_DA = D[1] - A[1]
arc_DA = patches.Arc(arc_center_DA, 2*arc_radius_DA, 2*arc_radius_DA, theta1=180, theta2=270, color="lime", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(arc_DA)

# Draw the brown rectangle (A, B, F, G)
brown_rectangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, F, G], closed=True, color="brown", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(brown_rectangle)

# Draw the white arc (G, A)
arc_center_GA = (G[0], G[1])
arc_radius_GA = A[1] - G[1]
arc_GA = patches.Arc(arc_center_GA, 2*arc_radius_GA, 2*arc_radius_GA, theta1=90, theta2=180, color="white", alpha=1.0)
ax.add_patch(arc_GA)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, A)
draw_right_angle(ax, D, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, A, D, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, A, D)
draw_right_angle(ax, A, B, F)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, F, G)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + F[0]) / 2, (B[1] + F[1]) / 2, "15", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="center")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The area of the lime semi-circle is 39.25 so the length of the AD diameter can be computed as $\sqrt{\frac{8 * 39.25}{\pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{314.0}{3.14}} = \sqrt{100.0} = 10$. The diameter of the semi-circle in the ABFG shape is equal to the side of the rectangle with length 15 so the shape has two sides with equal but unknown lengths, one side with length 15, and one semi-circle arc with diameter 15. So the perimeter is $2 * UnknownSide + 15 + \frac{15 * \pi}{2}$. So $2 * UnknownSide + 15 + \frac{15 * 3.14}{2} = 78$. So $2 * UnknownSide = 78 - 15 - \frac{15 * 3.14}{2} = 78 - 15 - \frac{47.1}{2} = 78 - 15 - 23.55 = 39.45$. Therefore, the length of the AB side is $\frac{39.45}{2} = 19.73$. The lengths of the AB and the AD sides of the ABCD rectangle are 19.73 and 10, so the area of the ABCD rectangle is $19.73 * 10 = 197.3$. Therefore the final answer is 197.3.
